member.name: T:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.IncompatibleSyncedFileException
member.summary: An exception thrown when attempting to open an incompatible Synchronized Realm file. This usually happens when the Realm file was created with an older version of the SDK and automatic migration to the current version is not possible. When such an exception occurs, the original file is moved to a backup location and a new file is created instead. If you wish to migrate any data from the backup location, you can use to obtain a that can then be used to open the backup Realm. After that, retry opening the original Realm file (which now should be recreated as an empty file) and copy all data from the backup file to the new one.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.IncompatibleSyncedFileException.GetBackupRealmConfig(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Gets a instance that can be used to open the backup Realm file.
member.param: Optional encryption key that was used to encrypt the original Realm file.
member.returns: A configuration object for the backup Realm.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.PermissionDeniedException
member.summary:
An error that indicates the user does not have permission to perform an operation upon a synced Realm. For example, a user may receive this error if they attempt to open a Realm they do not have at least read access to, or write to a Realm they only have read access to.
This error may also occur if a user incorrectly opens a Realm they have read-only permissions to without using the API. A Realm that suffers a permission denied error is, by default, flagged so that its local copy will be deleted the next time the application starts.
The exposes a method that can be called with a single argument: true to immediately delete the Realm file, or false to not delete the file at all (either now or upon restart). This method should only be called with true if and when your app disposes of every instance of the offending Realm on all threads.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.Exceptions.PermissionDeniedException.DeleteRealmUserInfo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: A method that can be called to manually initiate or cancel the Realm file deletion process. If the method isn't called at all, the Realm file will be deleted the next time your application is launched and the sync subsystem is initialized. Can only be called once.
member.param: Controls whether to initiate deletion immediately or cancel it altogether.
member.returns: true if actions were run successfully, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.ClassPrivileges
member.summary: A description of the actual privileges which apply to a Class within a Realm.
member.remarks: This is a combination of all of the privileges granted to all of the Roles which the current User is a member of, obtained by calling or .

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ClassPrivileges.Read
member.summary: If this flag is not present, the current User is not permitted to see objects of this type, and attempting to query this class will always return empty results.
member.remarks: Note that Read permissions are transitive, and so it may be possible to read an object which the user does not directly have Read permissions for by following a link to it from an object they do have Read permissions for. This does not apply to any of the other permission types.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ClassPrivileges.Update
member.summary: If this flag is not present, no modifications to objects of this type are permitted. Write transactions modifying the objects can be performed locally, but any changes made will be reverted by the server.
member.remarks: Deleting an object is considered a modification, and is governed by this privilege.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ClassPrivileges.SetPermissions
member.summary: If this flag is not present, no modifications to the permissions property of the object for this type are permitted. Write transactions can be performed locally, but any changes made will be reverted by the server.
member.remarks:
Note that if invalid privilege changes are made, will return results reflecting those invalid changes until synchronization occurs.
Even if this flag is present, note that the user will be unable to grant more privileges to a Role than what they have themselves, e.g. they won't be able to grant if they haven't been granted first.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ClassPrivileges.Subscribe
member.summary: If this flag is not present, the User is not permitted to create new subscriptions for this class. Local queries against the objects within the Realm will work, but new subscriptions will never add objects to the Realm.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ClassPrivileges.Create
member.summary: If this flag is not present, creating new objects of this type is not permitted. Write transactions creating objects can be performed locally, but the objects will be deleted by the server when synchronization occurs.
member.remarks: For objects with Primary Keys, it may not be locally determinable if or privileges are applicable. It may appear that you are creating a new object, but an object with that Primary Key may already exist and simply not be visible to you, in which case it is actually an Update operation.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.ObjectPrivileges
member.summary: A description of the actual privileges which apply to a specific Object.
member.remarks: This is a combination of all of the privileges granted to all of the Roles which the current User is a member of, obtained by calling

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ObjectPrivileges.Read
member.summary: If this flag is not present, the current User is not permitted to read this object directly.
member.remarks: Note that Read permissions are transitive, and so it may be possible to read an object which the user does not directly have Read permissions for by following a link to it from an object they do have Read permissions for. This does not apply to any of the other permission types.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ObjectPrivileges.Update
member.summary: If this flag is not present, modifying the fields of this type is not permitted. Write transactions modifying the objects can be performed locally, but any changes made will be reverted by the server.
member.remarks: Note that even if the user has permission, they may not be able to modify the IList<Permission> property of the object (if it exists), as that is governed by .

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ObjectPrivileges.Delete
member.summary: If this flag is not present, deleting this object is not permitted. Write transactions which delete the object can be performed locally, but the server will restore it.
member.remarks: It is possible to have but not privileges, or vice versa. For objects with primary keys, but not is ill-advised as an object can be updated by deleting and recreating it.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ObjectPrivileges.SetPermissions
member.summary: If this flag is not present, modifying the privileges of this specific object is not permitted.
member.remarks:
Object-specific permissions are set by declaring an IList<Permission> property on the subclass. Modifications to this property are controlled by rather than .
Even if this flag is present, note that the user will be unable to grant more privileges to a Role than what they have themselves, e.g. they won't be able to grant if they haven't been granted first.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.Permission
member.summary: A permission which can be applied to a Realm, Class, or specific Object.
member.remarks: Permissions are applied by adding the permission to the singleton object, the object for the desired class, or to a user-defined IList<Permission> property on a specific Object instance. The meaning of each of the properties of depend on what the permission is applied to, and so are left undocumented here. See , , and for details about what each of the properties mean when applied to that type.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.PermissionRole
member.summary: A Role within the permissions system.
member.remarks:
A Role consists of a name for the role and a list of users which are members of the role. Roles are granted privileges on Realms, Classes and Objects, and in turn grant those privileges to all users which are members of the role.
A role named "everyone" is automatically created in new Realms, and all new users which connect to the Realm are automatically added to it. Any other roles you wish to use are managed as normal Realm objects.

member.summary: Gets the name of the Role.

member.param: The Realm where the Role will be created.

member.returns: A instance that can be inspected or manipulated.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.RealmPrivileges.Read
member.summary: If this flag is not present, the current User is not permitted to see the Realm at all. This can happen only if the Realm was created locally and has not yet been synchronized.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.RealmPrivileges.Update
member.summary: If this flag is not present, no modifications to the Realm are permitted. Write transactions can be performed locally, but any changes made will be reverted by the server. and will always be denied when this is denied.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.RealmPrivileges.SetPermissions
member.summary: If this flag is not present, no modifications to the permissions property of the object for are permitted. Write transactions can be performed locally, but any changes made will be reverted by the server.
member.remarks:
Note that if invalid privilege changes are made, will return results reflecting those invalid changes until synchronization occurs.
Even if this flag is present, note that the user will be unable to grant more privileges to a Role than what they have themselves, e.g. they won't be able to grant if they haven't been granted first.
Adding or removing Users from a Role is controlled by privileges on that Role, and not by this value.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.RealmPrivileges.ModifySchema
member.summary: If this flag is not present, the user is not permitted to add new object types to the Realm or add new properties to existing object types.
member.remarks: Defining new subclasses (and not excluding them from the schema with will result in the application crashing if the object types are not first added on the server by a more privileged user.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.PermissionExtensions
member.summary: A set of extension methods that simplify working with object level permissions.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.PermissionExtensions.GetPrivileges(Realms.Realm)
member.summary:
Returns the computed privileges which the current user has for this Realm.
This combines all privileges granted on the Realm by all Roles which the current User is a member of into the final privileges which will be enforced by the server.
The privilege calculation is done locally using cached data, and inherently may be stale.It is possible that this method may indicate that an operation is permitted but the server will still reject it if permission is revoked before the changes have been integrated on the server.
Non-synchronized Realms always have permission to perform all operations.
member.param: The Realm whose privileges are inspected.
member.returns: The privileges which the current user has for the current Realm.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.PermissionExtensions.GetPrivileges``1(Realms.Realm)
member.summary:
Returns the computed privileges which the current user has for the given class.
This combines all privileges granted on the class by all Roles which the current User is a member of into the final privileges which will be enforced by the server.
The privilege calculation is done locally using cached data, and inherently may be stale. It is possible that this method may indicate that an operation is permitted but the server will still reject it if permission is revoked before the changes have been integrated on the server.
Non-synchronized Realms always have permission to perform all operations.
member.typeparam: The inheritor to get the privileges for.
member.param: The Realm whose privileges are inspected.
member.returns: The privileges which the current user has for the given class.

member.summary:
Returns the computed privileges which the current user has for the given class.
This combines all privileges granted on the class by all Roles which the current User is a member of into the final privileges which will be enforced by the server.
The privilege calculation is done locally using cached data, and inherently may be stale. It is possible that this method may indicate that an operation is permitted but the server will still reject it if permission is revoked before the changes have been integrated on the server.
Non-synchronized Realms always have permission to perform all operations.
member.param: The Realm whose privileges are inspected.
The name of a inheritor to get the privileges for.
member.returns: The privileges which the current user has for the given class.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.PermissionExtensions.GetPrivileges(Realms.Realm,Realms.RealmObject)
member.summary: Returns the computed privileges which the current user has for the given object.
member.remarks:
This combines all privileges granted on the object by all Roles which the current User is a member of into the final privileges which will be enforced by the server.
The privilege calculation is done locally using cached data, and inherently may be stale. It is possible that this method may indicate that an operation is permitted but the server will still reject it if permission is revoked before the changes have been integrated on the server.
Non-synchronized Realms always have permission to perform all operations.
The object must be a valid object managed by this Realm. Passing in an invalidated object, an unmanaged object, or an object managed by a different Realm will throw an exception.
member.param: The Realm whose privileges are inspected.
A managed object to get the privileges for.
member.returns: The privileges which the current user has for the given object.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.Session
member.summary: An object encapsulating a Realm Object Server session. Sessions represent the communication between the client (and a local Realm file on disk), and the server (and a remote Realm at a given URL stored on a Realm Object Server). Sessions are always created by the SDK and vended out through various APIs. The lifespans of sessions associated with Realms are managed automatically.

member.name: E:Realms.Sync.Session.Error
member.summary: Triggered when an error occurs on a session. The sender argument will be the session which has errored.

member.value: The where the Realm Object Server resides.

member.summary: Gets the sessions current state.
member.value: An enum value indicating the state of the session.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Session.User
member.summary: Gets the defined by the that is used to connect to the Realm Object Server.
member.value: The that was used to create the 's .

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.Session.Reconnect
member.summary: Attempts to reconnect all sessions.
member.remarks: By default, the sync engine will attempt to reconnect sessions at incrementing intervals. This method is useful when you are monitoring connectivity yourself, using e.g. Connectivity Plugin or through the native connectivity API and you wish to cancel that delay and try to reconnect immediately.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.Session.GetProgressObservable(Realms.Sync.ProgressDirection,Realms.Sync.ProgressMode)
member.summary: Gets an that can be used to track upload or download progress.
member.remarks: To start receiving notifications, you should call on the returned object. The token returned from should be retained as long as progress notifications are desired. To stop receiving notifications, call on the token. You don't need to keep a reference to the observable itself. The progress callback will always be called once immediately upon subscribing in order to provide the latest available status information.
member.returns: An observable that you can subscribe to and receive progress updates.
member.param: The transfer direction (upload or download) to track in the subscription callback.
The desired behavior of this progress notification block.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.Subscription.UnsubscribeAsync(Realms.Realm,System.String)
member.summary:
Cancel a named subscription that was created by calling .
Removing a subscription will delete all objects from the local Realm that were matched only by that subscription and not any remaining subscriptions. The deletion is performed by the server, and so has no immediate impact on the contents of the local Realm. If the device is currently offline, the removal will not be processed until the device returns online.
member.param: The Realm where this subscription was added.
The name of the subscription to remove.
member.returns: An awaitable task, that indicates that the subscription has been removed locally.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.Subscription.UnsubscribeAsync``1(Realms.Sync.Subscription{``0})
member.summary:
Cancel a subscription that was created by calling .
Removing a subscription will delete all objects from the local Realm that were matched only by that subscription and not any remaining subscriptions. The deletion is performed by the server, and so has no immediate impact on the contents of the local Realm. If the device is currently offline, the removal will not be processed until the device returns online.
member.typeparam: The type of the objects that make up the subscription query.
member.param: The subscription to cancel.
member.returns: An awaitable task, that indicates that the subscription has been removed locally.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.Subscription`1
member.summary:
A class that represents a subscription to a set of objects in a synced Realm.
When partial sync is enabled for a synced Realm, the only objects that the server synchronizes to the client are those that match a sync subscription registered by that client. A subscription consists of of a query (represented by an IQueryable{T}) and an optional name.
The state of the subscription can be observed by subscribing to the event handler.
Subscriptions are created by calling .
member.typeparam: The type of the objects that make up the subscription query.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Subscription`1.State
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the state of this subscription.
member.value: The state of the subscription.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Subscription`1.Error
member.summary: Gets a value indicating what error (if any) has occurred while processing the subscription. If the is not , this will be null.
member.value: An instance of if an error has occurred; null otherwise.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.Subscription`1.Results
member.summary: Gets the query that this subscription is associated with. Regardless of the state of the subscription, this value will reflect the results in the local Realm. This allows you to data-bind to this property immediately and show the last synchronized data. If the is , the values returned will not be an adequate representation of the state of the remote Realm.
member.value: A queryable collection that can be further filtered, ordered, or observed for changes.

member.summary: Waits for the subscription to complete synchronizing (equivalent to transitioning to the state.
member.returns: An awaitable task, that, upon completion, indicates that the objects matching the specified query have been synchronized to the local Realm.

member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the trusted root certificate(s) authority (CA) in PEM format, that should be used to validate the TLS connections to the Realm Object Server.
member.value: The path to the certificate.
member.remarks:
The file will be copied at runtime into the internal storage.
It is recommended to include only the root CA you trust, and not the entire list of root CA as this file will be loaded at runtime. It is your responsibility to download and verify the correct PEM for the root CA you trust.
This property is ignored on Apple platforms - you should use the KeyChain API to install your certificate instead.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.User
member.summary: This class represents a user on the Realm Object Server. The credentials are provided by various 3rd party providers (Facebook, Google, etc.). A user can log in to the Realm Object Server, and if access is granted, it is possible to synchronize the local and the remote Realm. Moreover, synchronization is halted when the user is logged out. It is possible to persist a user. By retrieving a user, there is no need to log in to the 3rd party provider again. Persisting a user between sessions, the user's credentials are stored locally on the device, and should be treated as sensitive data.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.User.Current
member.summary: Gets the currently logged-in user. If none exists, null is returned. If more than one user is currently logged in, an exception is thrown.
member.value: Valid user or null to indicate nobody logged in.
member.exception: Thrown if there are more than one users logged in.

member.summary: Logs the user in to the Realm Object Server.

The URI of the server that the user is authenticated against.
member.returns: An awaitable Task, that, upon completion, contains the logged in user.

member.name: M:Realms.Sync.User.ConfigurePersistence(Realms.Sync.UserPersistenceMode,System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configures user persistence. If you need to call this, be sure to do so before accessing any other Realm API.
member.param: The persistence mode.
The key to encrypt the persistent user store with.
If set to true reset the persistent user store on error.
member.remarks:
Users are persisted in a realm file within the application's sandbox.
By default objects are persisted and are additionally protected with an encryption key stored in the iOS Keychain when running on an iOS device (but not on a Simulator). On Android users are persisted in plaintext, because the AndroidKeyStore API is only supported on API level 18 and up. You might want to provide your own encryption key on Android or disable persistence for security reasons.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.PermissionChange
member.summary: Objects of this class allow to change permissions of owned Realms. They are created exclusively by the client and are processed by the server as indicated by the status fields.
member.remarks: objects allow to grant and revoke permissions by setting , and accordingly. If any of these flags are not set, these are merged with either the existing or default permissions as applicable. As a side-effect this causes that the default permissions are permanently materialized for the affected Realm files and the affected user. Once the request has been processed, the , , and will be updated accordingly.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.PermissionOffer
member.summary: Objects of this class are used to offer permissions to owned Realms. They are created exclusively by the client and are processed by the server as indicated by the status fields.
member.remarks: When offering permissions, you should create the offer and add it to the 's Management Realm. Then you should subscribe to to be notified when the server has processed the request. Once the request has been processed, the , , and will be updated accordingly. If the request has been processed successfully, the will be populated and you can share it with users you wish to grant permissions to. If the request has failed, the will be updated with relevant information about the failure and will be set to a non-null value.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.IPermissionObject.ErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the if any.
member.remarks: Filled by the server after an object was processed indicating the status of the operation. If returns , the property can be used to get a strongly typed code for the error and handle expected error conditions, such as expired offer or attempting to share a realm without having manage access.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.ProgressDirection
member.summary: The transfer direction (upload or download) tracked by a given progress notification subscription.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ProgressDirection.Upload
member.summary: Monitors upload progress.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ProgressDirection.Download
member.summary: Monitors download progress.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.ProgressMode
member.summary: The desired behavior of a progress notification subscription.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ProgressMode.ReportIndefinitely
member.summary: The callback will be called forever, or until it is unregistered by disposing the subscription token. Notifications will always report the latest number of transferred bytes, and the most up-to-date number of total transferable bytes.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.ProgressMode.ForCurrentlyOutstandingWork
member.summary: The callback will, upon registration, store the total number of bytes to be transferred. When invoked, it will always report the most up-to-date number of transferable bytes out of that original number of transferable bytes. When the number of transferred bytes reaches or exceeds the number of transferable bytes, the callback will be unregistered.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.SyncProgress
member.summary: A struct containing information about the progress state at a given instant.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.SyncProgress.TransferredBytes
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes that have been transferred since subscribing for progress notifications.
member.value: The number of transferred bytes.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.SyncProgress.TransferableBytes
member.summary: Gets the total number of bytes that have to be transferred since subscribing for progress notifications. The difference between that number and gives you the number of bytes not yet transferred. If the difference is 0, then all changes at the instant the callback fires have been successfully transferred.
member.value: The number of transferable bytes.

member.name: T:Realms.Sync.AccessLevel
member.summary:
Access levels which can be granted to Realm Platform users for specific synchronized Realms, using the permissions APIs.
Note that each access level guarantees all allowed actions provided by less permissive access levels. Specifically, users with write access to a Realm can always read from that Realm, and users with administrative access can always read or write from the Realm.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.AccessLevel.None
member.summary: No access whatsoever.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.AccessLevel.Read
member.summary: User can only read the contents of the Realm.
member.remarks: Users who have read-only access to a Realm should open the Realm using Attempting to directly open the Realm is an error; in this case the Realm must be deleted and re-opened.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.AccessLevel.Write
member.summary: User can read and write the contents of the Realm.

member.name: F:Realms.Sync.AccessLevel.Admin
member.summary: User can read, write, and administer the Realm, including granting permissions to other users.

member.name: P:Realms.Sync.PermissionCondition.Default
member.summary: Gets a that describes the default permissions for all users who don't have explicit permissions applied. The granted alongside this condition will also be used as default access level for future new users.
member.remarks: The default permissions are not additive with more specific permissions, even if the latter are more restrictive - for example, a user who has been granted access will not be write to a Realm, even if the default permissions grant access.
